Package editor

Class Editor

  • java.lang.Object
    • editor.Editor
  • class Editor
extends java.lang.Object
    A class that represents the level editor

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private java.util.ArrayList<Element> elements
      An ArrayList of all of the elements in the editor
      private int levelNumber
      The number of the level being edited
      private int sizeX
      The size of the level editor
      private int sizeY
      The size of the level editor

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Editor​(int sizeX, int sizeY, int levelNumber)
      Constructs a new Editor Fills the border of the editor with walls

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description

      Paints the current state of the level
      private void placeBreakableWall​(int x, int y)
      Places a BreakableWall at the given position If an element exists there already, does nothing and returns
      private void placeGrayGreenTank​(int x, int y)
      Places a GrayTank at the given position If a GrayTank exists at the position, places a GreenTank If a GreenTank exists at the position, places a GrayTank If any other element exists at the position, does nothing and returns

      Places a Hole at the given position If an element exists there already, does nothing and returns

      Places a Player at the given position If an element exists there already, does nothing and returns

      Places a RedTank at the given position If an element exists there already, does nothing and returns

      private void placeWall​(int x, int y)
      Places a Wall at the given position If an element exists there already, does nothing and returns
      private void placeYellowTank​(int x, int y)
      Places a YellowTank at the given position If an element exists there already, does nothing and returns
      private void removeElement​(int x, int y)
      Removes any element at the given position
      private void saveLevel()
      Saves the current state of the level This gets saved into the levels folder
      private void setupLevel()
      Places walls on the border of the level
